class_notes:
Title:  Human Flourishing-Imagine A Just City.
This course is in the Arts and Science Social Justice Fellows program for the Fall 2022 semester.  Students will have the opportunity to work with an Atlanta artist and explore social justice issues relevant to the course topic.
Course Description:  During the semester, students will explore what it means to imagine opportunities in the United States and social justice policies and programs in the areas of health, climate change, education, food systems, the criminal legal system, housing, economics, and the environment.  We will combine research and discussion of social justice with readings by James Baldwin and exercises in imagining using the participatory poetry of Yoko Ono.
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
